label: IT Service Management (ITSM)
description: Transforms reactive break-fix IT support into AI-powered self-service with high chatbot resolution, automated routing, and improved first contact resolution through intelligent ticket classification, knowledge management, and auto-remediation.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual ticket triage with low first contact resolution, high escalation rate, and no self-service capability resulting in high IT staff overhead.
characteristics: Manual ticket categorization and assignment by service desk agents
High percentage of tickets escalated from Level 1 to Level 2/3
No self-service (employees always create tickets)
Long average handle time per ticket
Knowledge base sparse with tribal knowledge in technician heads
SLA breaches common with no proactive alerts
Same incidents recur with no continuous improvement
constraints: Manual ticket triage delays correct team assignment
No automation (every ticket requires human touch)
Alert storms during outages create hundreds of duplicate tickets

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'HDI Service Desk Benchmarking Report 2024']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Service desk escalation benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'IT service desk productivity benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Enterprise IT service desk metrics']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'IT service satisfaction surveys']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Service desk SLA performance studies']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered ITSM with chatbot self-service, automated routing, and auto-remediation achieving high first contact resolution.
characteristics: AI Ticket Classification Agent auto-categorizes and prioritizes
Chatbot Self-Service Agent resolves password resets and software installs automatically
Auto-Routing Agent assigns to best-fit technician by skills and workload
Auto-Remediation Agent executes scripts for common issues
Knowledge Management Agent suggests solutions from knowledge base
SLA Management Agent monitors and escalates at-risk tickets
Continuous Improvement Agent identifies recurring incidents and recommends fixes
benefits: High chatbot resolution rate (no human needed)
Increased IT staff capacity (less time on routine tickets)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AI auto-remediation, knowledge base suggestions, and chatbot handling tier-1 issues']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on conversational AI handling password resets, software installs, and common requests without human agent']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AI classification, auto-routing, and knowledge suggestions accelerating resolution']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automation resolving tickets faster and chatbot preventing ticket creation']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated SLA monitoring, proactive escalation, and faster resolution times']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on faster resolution, 24/7 chatbot availability, and self-service convenience']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automation handling routine tickets, freeing staff for complex issues and projects']

quickWins: Chatbot for password resets (40% of tickets)
prerequisites: Modern ITSM platform (ServiceNow, Jira Service Management)

label: Infrastructure Operations & Monitoring (AIOps)
description: Transforms reactive incident response into predictive, self-healing infrastructure with dramatic alert noise reduction, faster MTTR, and high auto-remediation through AI-powered monitoring, anomaly detection, and automated runbooks.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual alert response with very high false positive rate, long MTTR, and chaotic war rooms resulting in on-call engineer burnout.
characteristics: Monitoring tools generate thousands of alerts per day
Very high false positive rate creates alert fatigue
Reactive incident response (discover after customer impact)
Manual correlation of alerts to identify root cause
War rooms chaotic with too many people and no clear owner
Long mean time to detect
Long mean time to resolution
constraints: Alert fatigue (thousands of alerts, majority false positives)
No predictive analytics (fix problems after they occur)
Runbooks outdated (if they exist at all)
On-call engineer burnout high (paged at 2am for false alarms)
No root cause analysis (fix symptom, not underlying issue)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Enterprise monitoring alert volume studies']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'AIOps alert fatigue research']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Infrastructure incident detection benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Infrastructure incident resolution benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Infrastructure problem management studies']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Infrastructure availability benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered AIOps with unified observability, predictive failure detection, and self-healing infrastructure achieving dramatically faster MTTR and significant incident prevention.
characteristics: AIOps Platform Agent ingests data from all monitoring tools
Anomaly Detection Agent reduces noise significantly (real issues only)
Alert Correlation Agent groups hundreds of alerts into single incident
Incident Prediction Agent forecasts failures before they occur
Auto-Remediation Agent executes runbooks automatically
Incident Response Agent orchestrates war room with context
Root Cause Analysis Agent identifies underlying issues via ML
benefits: Mean time to detect significantly faster
Mean time to resolution dramatically faster
On-call quality of life improved (fewer false alarms)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML anomaly detection filtering false positives and alert correlation grouping related alerts']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on real-time anomaly detection and predictive analytics identifying issues before impact']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated remediation, root cause identification, and contextualized incident response']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated runbook execution for common incidents and self-healing infrastructure']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on predictive analytics forecasting failures and proactive intervention before customer impact']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on predictive failure detection and automated remediation reducing unplanned downtime']

label: IT Asset Management (ITAM)
description: Transforms manual spreadsheet tracking into automated asset discovery with high inventory accuracy, near-perfect license compliance, and significant software license savings through continuous monitoring and optimization.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual spreadsheet tracking with moderate inventory accuracy, moderate license compliance, and significant software license waste resulting in audit fines and overspending.
characteristics: Asset inventory tracked in spreadsheets (always outdated)
No automated discovery (manual data entry)
Software license compliance manual (annual audit reveals issues)
Asset procurement slow (weeks to get laptop)
No visibility into software usage (paying for unused licenses)
Shadow IT unknown (employees buy cloud services secretly)
End-of-life assets not identified (security risk)
constraints: Long time to provision new asset
Significant software license waste (paying for unused)
Shadow IT apps discovered during audits

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'ITAM asset tracking accuracy benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Software license audit compliance studies']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'IT asset procurement cycle time benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Software license utilization studies']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Enterprise shadow IT discovery research']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered ITAM with automated asset discovery, continuous license optimization, and shadow IT detection achieving high inventory accuracy and significant license cost savings.
characteristics: Asset Discovery Agent auto-discovers all devices, software, cloud services
License Management Agent tracks installs and optimizes allocation
Asset Lifecycle Agent monitors warranties and end-of-life dates
Procurement Automation Agent auto-approves standard requests
Usage Analytics Agent identifies unused licenses
Shadow IT Detection Agent discovers unauthorized cloud services
Compliance & Audit Agent generates reports instantly

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated network discovery, endpoint agents, and continuous asset tracking']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on continuous license tracking, automated compliance monitoring, and usage optimization']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated approval workflows and pre-configured asset provisioning']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on usage analytics identifying unused licenses for reclamation or non-renewal']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on continuous cloud service discovery via SSO logs, network monitoring, and expense analysis']

quickWins: Automated asset discovery (know what you have)
Shadow IT discovery (SaaS apps via SSO logs)
prerequisites: ITAM platform (or ITSM with ITAM module)

label: Cybersecurity Operations (SecOps)
description: Transforms reactive threat response into proactive AI-powered security with dramatic alert noise reduction, dramatically faster threat detection, and high auto-remediation through SOAR, threat hunting, and vulnerability management.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual alert review with very high false positive rate, very long breach detection time, and reactive incident response resulting in analyst burnout and major security incidents.
characteristics: Security tools generate thousands of alerts per day
Very high false positive rate creates alert fatigue
Very long mean time to detect breach
Long mean time to respond
Manual investigation takes many hours
Threat hunting periodic (weekly or monthly)
Vulnerability scans monthly (outdated by time remediated)
constraints: Alert fatigue (thousands of security alerts, very high false positive rate)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'SIEM alert volume benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Security operations alert fatigue research']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'IBM Cost of Data Breach Report 2024']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Incident response time benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Vulnerability management lifecycle studies']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Phishing simulation campaign benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered SecOps with SOAR automation, continuous threat hunting, and predictive vulnerability management achieving dramatically faster threat detection and high auto-remediation.
characteristics: Security Orchestration Agent ingests alerts from all security tools
Threat Detection Agent identifies real threats using ML
Automated Investigation Agent correlates alerts and enriches with threat intel
Incident Response Agent executes playbooks automatically
Threat Hunting Agent proactively searches for threats continuously
Vulnerability Management Agent prioritizes and auto-patches
Security Analytics Agent provides posture scoring and insights
benefits: Mean time to detect breach dramatically faster
Mean time to respond dramatically faster
